intro: Wichuraea involucrosa, commonly known as the woolly nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, toxic berries that are not edible for humans. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
